intro: Alatiglossum medinense, commonly known as the Medinense Alatiglossum, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
